By Council Member Quinn:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. 20020447 ZSM shall be subject to review by the Council.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass a bill to restore the right to vote for parolees, and also calling upon the United States Congress to pass H.R.259, also known as the Civic Participation and Rehabilitation Act of 2003, to secure the federal voting rights of persons who have been released from incarceration.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by the Council by voice-vote; 8 Council Members formerly objected: Council Members Avella, Gallagher, Gennaro, Lanza, Nelson, Provenzano, Vallone Jr and Oddo.
Items.MatterName: Restore the right to vote to parolees.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Health

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Congress to pass legislation repealing the provisions of federal law that discourage states from providing in-state tuition rates to undocumented immigrants and permitting long-time resident youth with good moral character who move on to higher education to obtain permanent resident status.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by the Council by voice-vote; 5 Council Members formerly objected: Council Members Gallagher, Lanza, Sears, Vallone Jr. and Oddo.
Items.MatterName: Senate to pass the DREAM Act (S.1291) and U.S. House of Representatives to pass the Student Adjustment Act (H.R. 1918)

Items.Title:
Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges, and Elections approving the appointment by the Mayor of GREGORIO MAYERS, ESQ. as a member of the New York City Environmental Control Board.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, which was referred to on January 29, 2003, respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to sections 31 and 1404 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the appointment by the Mayor of GREGORIO MAYERS, ESQ. as a member of the New York City Environmental Control Board (General Public Member) for a four-year term that will begin on March 6, 2003 and expires on March 5, 2007.

Res. No. ______

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE MAYOR OF GREGORIO MAYERS, ESQ. AS A MEMBER OF THE NEW YORK CITY ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL BOARD.

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to sections 31 and 1404 of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the appointment by the Mayor of GREGORIO MAYERS, ESQ. as a member of the New York City Environmental Control Board (General Public Member) for a four-year term that will begin on March 6, 2003 and expires on March 5, 2007.
Items.MatterName: M 419 - Gregorio Mayers, Appointment, Member of Environmental Control Board

Items.Title:
Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges, and Elections approving the appointment by the Mayor of Steven Charles Russo, ESQ. as a member of the New York City Environmental Control Board.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, which was referred to on January 29, 2003, respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to sections 31 and 1404 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the appointment by the Mayor of STEVEN CHARLES RUSSO, ESQ. as a member of the New York City Environmental Control Board (Water Pollution Control Background) for the remainder of a four-year term that began on March 6, 2001 and expires on March 5, 2005.

Res. No. _____

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE MAYOR OF STEVEN CHARLES RUSSO, ESQ. AS A MEMBER OF THE NEW YORK CITY ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL BOARD.

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to sections 31 and 1404 of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the appointment by the Mayor of STEVEN CHARLES RUSSO, ESQ. as a member of the New York City Environmental Control Board (Water Pollution Control Background) for the remainder of a four-year term that began on March 6, 2001 and expires on March 5, 2005.
Items.MatterName: M 420 - Steven C. Russo, Appointment, Member of Environmental Control Board.

Res. No. ____

Items.Title:
Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges, and Elections approving the appointment by the Mayor of Roberta Brandes Gratz as a member of the New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, which was referred to on January 29, 2003, respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to sections 31 and 3020 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the appointment by the Mayor of ROBERTA BRANDES GRATZ as a member of the New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission for the remainder of a three-year term that expires on June 28, 2003.

Res. No. ____

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE MAYOR OF ROBERTA BRANDES GRATZ AS A MEMBER OF THE NEW YORK CITY LANDMARKS PRESERVATION COMMISSION.

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to sections 31 and 3020 of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the appointment by the Mayor of ROBERTA BRANDES GRATZ as a member of the New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission for the remainder of a three-year term that expires on June 28, 2003.
Items.MatterName: M 422 - Roberta B. Gratz, Appointment, Member of Landmarks Preservation Commission.

Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
Resolution declaring February 23rd, 2003 as "W.E.B. DuBois Day" in the City of New York.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Declaring February 23rd, 2003 as "W.E.B. DuBois Day"

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Congress of the United States to adopt S.138, in relation to temporarily increasing the Federal Medical Assistance Percentage (FMAP) for the Medicaid program and block grants to states for social services.
Items.MatterName: Temporarily increasing the Federal Medical Assistance Percentage (FMAP)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to restrictions regarding engine idling.
Items.MatterName: Restrictions regarding engine idling.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council of the City of New York to hold hearings on the timeliness of the Department of Sanitation's program for  replacement of litter baskets and the placement of additional litter baskets at commercial and residential locations with increased retail activity and heavy pedestrian traffic.
Items.MatterName: Dept of Sanitation's program for  replacement of litter baskets.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Department of Sanitation to use flexibility in supplementing and redirecting sanitation resources to community districts with the dirtiest streets and sidewalks so that all communities will maintain an excellent quality of life.
Items.MatterName: Redirecting sanitation resources to CD's with the dirtiest streets and sidewalks.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring supermarket property owners to provide sixty days public notice of closure.
Items.MatterName: Requiring supermarket property owners to provide sixty days public notice of closure.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to clarifying the rights of pet owners in multiple dwellings and granting senior citizens residing in such buildings the right to keep pets in their apartments.
Items.MatterName: Clarifying the rights of pet owners in multiple dwellings.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the Metropolitan Transportation Authority-New York City Transit (MTA-NYCT) to delay a final fare hike vote until updated financial data is available that would justify such a fare increase.
Items.MatterName: MTA-NYCT to delay a final fare hike vote until updated financial data is available.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on New York State Governor George Pataki and the New York State Legislature to restructure the Board of Directors of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to include voting members representing the riding public and labor.
Items.MatterName: Restructure the Bd of Directors of the MTA to include voting members representing the riding public and labor.

Items.Title: Resolution denouncing the recent judicial decision to modify and ease the Handschu Agreement's surveillance restrictions, thereby expanding the ability of the NYPD to monitor the activities of political groups in certain cases.
Items.MatterName: Denouncing the recent judicial decision to modify and ease the Handschu Agreement's surveillance restrictions.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the installation of food waste disposals in residential buildings.
Items.MatterName: Installation of food waste disposals in residential buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the procurement of energy efficient products.
Items.MatterName: Procurement of energy efficient products.

Items.Title: Resolution viewing the current and impending Mitchell-Lama buyouts as a threat to the already limited availability of affordable housing In New York City and calling upon the appropriate Committee of the Council to conduct hearings to further explore this situation and possible methods for intervention.
Items.MatterName: Viewing the current and impending Mitchell-Lama buyouts.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the requirements of the campaign finance program for city elections, and to amend the charter of the city of New York, in relation to appointments to the New York City Campaign Finance Board and use of government resources during an election year.
Items.MatterName: Requirements of the campaign finance program for city elections.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating disclosure requirements for tax preparers who offer refund anticipation loans.
Items.MatterName: Creating disclosure requirements for tax preparers who offer refund anticipation loans.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the inspection and certification for pest abatement.
Items.MatterName: The inspection and certification for pest abatement.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York in relation to informing employees of their potential rights to tax credits and social service benefits.
Items.MatterName: Informing employees of their potential rights to tax credits and social service benefits.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Members Spano and Wirth, A.1747, "AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to designated agencies in certain cities".
Items.MatterName: Designated agencies in certain cities (A.1747)

Items.Title: StateState Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Members Lavelle and M. Cohen, A.2176, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to certification of architectural plans".
Items.MatterName: Certification of architectural plans (A.2176)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Velella, Golden, Maltese, Marchi, Mendez and Padavan, S.867, and Assembly Members Abbate and McLaughlin, A.3471, "AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to certain impairments of health presumed accidental or incurred in the performance of duty".
Items.MatterName: Certain impairments of health presumed accidental or incurred in the performance of duty (S.867, A.3471)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Members Millman, Seddio, Cymbrowitz, Greene, Klein, Espaillat and Ortiz, et al, A.3829, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the repair, construction and maintenance of athletic fields in the city of New York".
Items.MatterName: Repair, construction and maintenance of athletic fields (A.3829)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing for a referendum of the people of the city of New York on the question "Shall a commission to provide for the separation of the city of New York from the state of New York and for the establishment of the state, or any other entity that such commission shall deem appropriate, of Greater New York be created?"
Items.MatterName: Shall a commission to provide for the separation of the city of NY from the state of NY.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to the issuance of permits for the repair and construction of streets and sidewalks by the Department of Transportation.
Items.MatterName: Issuance of permits for the repair and construction of streets and sidewalks by DOT.
